title: Robinzon Díaz
text:
Robinzon Díaz Henriquez (born September 19, 1983) is a <a href="Dominican%20Republic">Dominican</a> former professional <a href="baseball">baseball</a> <a href="catcher">catcher</a>. He played in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> (MLB) for the <a href="Toronto%20Blue%20Jays">Toronto Blue Jays</a> and <a href="Pittsburgh%20Pirates">Pittsburgh Pirates</a>. He was the bullpen catcher for the <a href="Milwaukee%20Brewers">Milwaukee Brewers</a> from 2017 to 2020.
Professional career.
Toronto Blue Jays.
On April 23, , Díaz made his Major League debut with the <a href="Toronto%20Blue%20Jays">Toronto Blue Jays</a> against the <a href="Tampa%20Bay%20Rays">Tampa Bay Rays</a> and went 0-for-4 with a <a href="strikeout">strikeout</a>.
Pittsburgh Pirates.
On August 25, 2008, Díaz was traded to the <a href="Pittsburgh%20Pirates">Pittsburgh Pirates</a> as the player to be named later to complete a trade for <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Bautista">José Bautista</a> and was assigned to the Triple-A <a href="Indianapolis%20Indians">Indianapolis Indians</a>. After spending several days with Indianapolis, he was called up by the Pirates on September 2. On September 7, 2008, Díaz got his first major league hit, a single off <a href="San%20Francisco%20Giants">San Francisco Giants</a> pitcher <a href="Jonathan%20S%C3%A1nchez">Jonathan Sánchez</a>.
Díaz began the 2009 season in Triple-A but was recalled to the Pirates late in April after starting catcher <a href="Ryan%20Doumit">Ryan Doumit</a> became sidelined with a broken wrist. He would serve mainly as backup to fellow rookie catcher <a href="Jason%20Jaramillo">Jason Jaramillo</a> and as an occasional <a href="pinch%20hitter">pinch hitter</a>. In his 31 games with Pittsburgh, Díaz compiled a .295 <a href="batting%20average%20%28baseball%29">batting average</a> and drove in 18 runs. He was optioned back to Triple-A when Doumit returned from injury on July 10.
He was <a href="designated%20for%20assignment">designated for assignment</a> at the end of the 2009 season, and released on November 30, 2009.
Detroit Tigers.
On December 8, 2009, he was signed to a contract by the <a href="Detroit%20Tigers">Detroit Tigers</a>.
Díaz spent the 2010 season as a member of the <a href="Toledo%20Mud%20Hens">Toledo Mud Hens</a>, finishing the season batting .255 with a home run and 21 RBI in 71 games. He filed for free agency on November 6, 2010.
Texas Rangers.
On January 18, 2011, he was signed to a minor league contract by the <a href="Texas%20Rangers%20%28baseball%29">Texas Rangers</a>.
He also played for the <a href="Tigres%20del%20Licey">Tigres del Licey</a> in the <a href="Dominican%20Winter%20League">Dominican Winter League</a>.
Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim.
Diaz signed a minor league contract with the <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Angels%20of%20Anaheim">Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim</a> on December 23, 2011. He was released on August 7, 2012.
Return to Texas.
The Rangers re-signed Diaz to a minor league contract on August 12, 2012, and assigned him to the Triple-A <a href="Round%20Rock%20Express">Round Rock Express</a>. On November 3, he was declared a minor league free agent by Major League Baseball.
Milwaukee Brewers.
On January 18, 2013, Díaz signed a minor league contract with the <a href="Milwaukee%20Brewers">Milwaukee Brewers</a>. He started the 2013 season with the Brewers' Double-A affiliate <a href="Huntsville%20Stars">Huntsville Stars</a>. He split the season with the Stars and Triple-A <a href="Nashville%20Sounds">Nashville</a>, where in 108 games total, he hit .302/.335/.433 with seven home runs and 42 RBI. After joining the Sounds on June 29, 2013, Díaz closed out the year by hitting .328 (58-for-127) with four home runs and 20 RBI in 50 <a href="Pacific%20Coast%20League">Pacific Coast League</a> games.
On October 1, 2013, Díaz signed a minor league deal with an invitation to spring training with the Brewers. He returned to Nashville for the start of the 2014 season.
The Brewers signed Diaz to another minor-league deal on February 23, 2015. The same day he was assigned to Triple-A <a href="Colorado%20Springs%20Sky%20Sox">Colorado Springs Sky Sox</a>. On April 6, 2015 he was demoted to the Double-A <a href="Helena%20Brewers">Helena Brewers</a>. On April 17, 2015, he was promoted back to Triple-A Colorado Springs. After the season, he was selected to the roster for the <a href="Dominican%20Republic%20national%20baseball%20team">Dominican Republic national baseball team</a> at the <a href="2015%20WBSC%20Premier12">2015 WBSC Premier12</a>.
Return to Toronto.
On February 26, 2016, Díaz signed a minor league contract with the Toronto Blue Jays.
Olmecas de Tabasco.
On May 17, 2016, Diaz signed with the <a href="Olmecas%20de%20Tabasco">Olmecas de Tabasco</a> of the <a href="Mexican%20League">Mexican League</a>. He was released on July 1, 2016.
Baseball staff.
Diaz became the bullpen catcher with the Milwaukee Brewers during the 2017 baseball season. He remained in the position through 2020.
